title: >>> CheckMATE?
body_text:
--
The Word According to Wesley
This coming Saturday at Wall High School, the newly crowned champ Wesley Hebrew looks to become the most dominant captain in almost the ten month history of dodgeball.
After defeating perhaps the most controversial, but certainly successful captain in Lenny Herrera, one can only wonder who Wesley's first opponent will be. It was no secret that Kevin Adams was looking to end Lenny's reign. However, Wesley cut that short for the both of them and it is he that stands on top of the mountain.
As for Kevin, his chance at becoming the man is just days away if he indeed still wants to be captain. Whatever the case, his return will be memorable for sure.
Lurking in the shadows is arguably the most destructive female competitor to ever grace the dodgeball court, Sara DeCuir. She will face the winner of this weekend's match at DODGEBALL 46. You can bet she will be at her best come [Friday] June 30th.
--
The Irony of the "SpengePoster"
The poster you see above is created by injured veteran Dan Spengeman. As always, he proves his creativity in each of his works. However, bad luck does seem to follow him.
More times than less, any time "Quick Sand" Dan creates an event poster, the attendance for the corresponding event sees a drastic change. Don't understand? Perhaps the list below will help:
DODGEBALL 18/DODGEBALL 19 Double Poster:
- These two events had the lowest attendances of any event in Season 2.
DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX:
- After winning the poster contest by a large margin, the attendance saw the complete opposite, dropping into a record low with 14.
DODGEBALL XXX-ONE:
- Just one week after an unforgettable Homecoming that was DODGEBALL 30, the aftermath proved to be a turn-around as far as attendance was concerned. From 34 at DODGEBALL 30, XXX-ONE saw the lowest of the low with 12.
DODGEBALL 43:
Just two weeks ago, the second of two consecutive ORP events saw the lowest attendance for any event thus far in Season V with 23.
In Dan's defense, DODGEBALL 21, DODGEBALL 33, and DODGEBALL 38 saw great numbers: 30, 34, 29.
.........
Concerns, questions; they are all answered at DODGEBALL 45.
June 24th ... 6:30pm ... WHS.
